NATIONAL HEALTH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
AN OMINOUS NEW DIRECTION ON CIVIL RIGHTS
description: To the Editor:

title: A REPORTER'S NOTEBOOK: THE DRUSE 'DON'T FOREGT'
description: One chilly morning, after enduring a night of heavy shelling from the United States Marines, a young Druse leader stalked around his dingy office here, jumpy with coffee nerves, eyes streaked red. The marines said they had opened fire to silence an attack from Druse guns. But the young man with the stubby pistol jammed in the waistband of his jeans insisted that the Americans had bombarded civilian areas, and now he was talking about getting even.

title: Nonaligned Group Backs 'Information Order'
description: The information ministers of the movement of nations professing nonalignment complained today of what they described as hostile propaganda by industrial countries against the 101-nation organization and called for ''a new world information order.''

title: WINNING STYLE ELUSIVE FOR NETS
description: It is not news that for the Nets, the events of last season - most notably, the acquisition of Micheal Ray Richardson and the sudden resignation of Coach Larry Brown - significantly altered the personality of a young and maturing team that had begun to establish itself as one to be reckoned with in pro basketball.

title: BRIEFS
description: * ACS Enterprises Inc., Bensalem, Pa., said it had signed a letter of agreement to acquire 51 percent of Home Viewer, a Philadelphia-based national magazine directed at users of video cassettes, for an undisclosed amount of ACS stock.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in The Living Section last Wednesday on the couture showings misidentified a Paris fashion house. The correct name is Lecoanet Hemant.

title: ECONOMICS AND PEACE
description: T he deployment of cruise and Pershing missiles has received much of the blame for the deteriorating relations between the United States and Europe. But economic problems are also to blame, and solving these problems is crucial if we are to reach agreement on how best to defend ourselves, and with what weapons.

title: NATIONAL CEMETERIES' BURIAL SPACE BEING INCREASED
description: Next year workmen will begin clearing the trees and brush from a wooded hillside 12 miles south of here where the Federal Government plans to build the largest national cemetery in the Southeast.

title: U.S. OFFICIALS FAULTED FOR TALKS OVER PESTICIDE BAN
description: In 1981 the Reagan Administration had before it a formal proposal to bar the use on foods of ethylene dibromide, a pesticide that has since been found in food and water supplies.

title: NOBILITY HOMES reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
SOFTWARE FOR THE MACINTOSH: PLENTY ON THE WAY
description: CONTRARY to what seems to be a popular notion, Apple did not invent the personal computer. The barebones Altair was introduced in 1974 and other personal computers were on the market several years before Apple rolled its first model out of a garage.

title: SHUTTLE: TOUCH OF BUCK ROGERS PLANNED
description: ON the next space shuttle mission, scheduled to begin Friday, two astronauts will put on Buck Rogers-style jet backpacks and fly out from the Challenger. For several hours, free of any connection with the spaceship and with their own power to maneuver, they will be in effect the first human satellites.

title: THE DANGERS OF EDB IN LEADED GASOLINE
description: To the Editor:

title: BLACK HILLS POWER & LIGHT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes a gain of $886,000 from an accounting adjustment for tax credits.

title: SCRIPPS-HOWARD BROADCASTING reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Protest for Seaver
description: A high school student from Yonkers has organized a rally Saturday at Shea Stadium to protest the loss of Tom Seaver to the Chicago White Sox. ''We will have a group of at least 100 Met fans at noon at Gate C, near the advance-ticket booth,'' said John Gilligan , a 17-year-old senior at Lincoln High. He said he was advocating that the Mets make an offer to the White Sox to get Seaver back.

title: SAINT LAURENT DOMINATES COUTURE
description: The Yves Saint Laurent opening in Paris last week was widely acclaimed as the best of the spring and summer haute couture shows. It was the high point of openings that included well-received collections by Hubert de Givenchy and Marc Bohan for Christian Dior. Emanuel Ungaro had a mixed reception: Some loved his clothes, others were more reserved. Karl Lagerfeld drew renewed attention to the venerable House of Chanel.

title: Mistrial Declared For Union Leader
description: A mistrial was declared today in the embezzlement trial of a labor leader, Frank Gerace, and two co-defendants after the jury said it was deadlocked.

title: EGYPT TO REJOIN ISLAMIC GROUP
description: Egypt said today that it had accepted an invitation to rejoin the 45-member Islamic Conference Organization.

title: ARMS NEGOTIATOR SAYS MORE TALKS COULD BRING PACT
description: The chief American negotiator on reducing strategic arms said today the United States and the Soviet Union were in a position ''to make a breakthrough'' if the Russians agreed to a date for resuming talks.

title: UNITED TECHNOLOGIES UP 22.4%
description: The United Technologies Corporation, aided by gains in its automotive, air-conditioning, semiconductor and military products markets, reported yesterday that net income in the fourth quarter increased 22.4 percent on a 9.9 percent rise in sales.

title: KNICKS ARE CLOSE TO MEETING GOALS
description: In addition to the usual X's and O's and play diagrams that provide an insight to the opponent's strengths and weaknesses, the big blackboard in the Knick dressing room carries a message from Coach Hubie Brown. The message rates the team's actual performance compared with the goals Brown has set for it. In effect it provides an answer to the question, ''How are we doing?''

title: FRED KOCH
description: I see Ed Koch has kicked up a furor with his book ''Mayor.'' It features one acerbic putdown after another against a former United States President, an incumbent City Council president, an ex-New York State Governor and the one currently in place and assorted political foes and allies.

title: DISCOVERY IS SEEN AS CLUE ON PLANTS
description: Unusual bacteria that may offer clues to the origin of photosynthesis have been discovered by scientists at Indiana University, the National Science Foundation has announced.

title: CONSERVATIVE GROUP OFFERS PLAN TO CUT THE DEFICIT
description: The Heritage Foundation, a conservative public policy organization, has laid out a plan that it said could slash $119 billion from the $180 billion deficit that President Reagan is expected to project this week in his budget for the next fiscal year.

title: NORMAN LEAR RETURNING TO SITCOM LAND
description: Norman Lear is returning to television - as the creator of a half-hour situation- comedy series for ABC-TV in which almost every character is Mexican- American. He is negotiating with Showtime for a bawdy comedy set in Restoration England that would be the first situation-comedy series on pay-cable. And he has sold a situation comedy that indicts television, ''Good Evening, He Lied,'' to NBC-TV.

title: Indonesia Elephants Romp
description: A herd of elephants gave unexpected help to a police drive to stamp out widespread drug farming in northern Sumatra, the official Antara news agency said today. The wild elephants, which had strayed from a nearby reserve, ran amok through 25 acres of marijuana, forcing the growers to flee their fields.

title: 'BALLANTRAE': BROTHERS VIE IN SCOTLAND
description: ''THE MASTER OF BALLANTRAE,'' Robert Louis Stevenson's story of two Scottish brothers and their bitter rivalry, has been lavishly staged for television. The production tonight, which will be shown at 8 P.M. on CBS, has tartans and ruffles and scenery galore. It also has fine, uncharacteristically fiery performances from both Michael York and Richard Thomas as the feuding siblings.

title: NEW MET CHAIRMAN DEFINES OBJECTIVES
description: J. RICHARDSON DILWORTH, the new board chairman of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, is determined to continue the blockbuster exhibitions, huge fund-raising programs and administrative policies of his powerful predecessor, C. Douglas Dillon.

title: ENVIRONMENTAL SYSTEMS reports earnings for Year to Oct 31
Talking Business with Ernest S. Liu of Goldman, Sachs
description: Nuclear Power Industry's Fate During the past three weeks, the nuclear power industry has been rocked by one setback after another. Experts in the field, after years of watching the cost of building nuclear plants multiply, are now more skeptical than ever about the future of the industry.

title: CAVCO INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CONCERT: 'BACH, BEBOP' BY ROUTCH
description: IN playing a program called ''Bach

title: McGovern and Cranston Routed by Iowa Fire
description: Two Democratic Presidential contenders, Alan Cranston and George McGovern, were routed from their beds at 5 A.M. today because of a mattress fire in the Julien Motor Hotel here.

title: Greek Officers Assigned To U.S. Military Bases
description: Greek military officers were assigned today to each of the four American bases in Greece, as agreed to under terms of a United States-Greek military and economic cooperation agreement that was signed in Athens last September.

title: CHINA USES BIG ROCKET TO LAUNCH COMMUNICATIONS SATELLITE
description: CHINA announced yesterday it had launched a space satellite that achieved ''important results,'' and Western experts speculated that this could be the debut of a more powerful Chinese rocket and the nation's first communications satellite.

title: CORRECTION
description: A headline Jan. 12 about a ruling by the National Labor Relations Board incorrectly characterized its action in the case of a truck driver who was discharged after complaining to a state commission about the safety of a truck he was assigned to drive. The board did not rule on the legality of the driver's protest but rather upheldthe company's action in dismissing him.

title: FORUM FOR APARTHEID: 3 RACES, 3 ROOMS
description: News Analysis

title: POSTAL INSTANT PRESS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Romann & Tannenholz Gets Benihana Project
description: Rocky Aoki, chairman of the Benihana of Tokyo restaurant chain, with the help of Romann & Tannenholz Advertising, is entering the booming frozen entree market, starting in New York with a $1 million advertising budget.

title: GALILEO ELECTRO-OPTICS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $160,000.

title: Phillips Climbs 59.4%; Unocal Decreases 20.9%
description: Two oil companies reported higher fourth-quarter profits yesterday, but a third recorded a drop, in keeping with the industry's mixed results for the quarter. Net increased 59.4 percent at the Phillips Petroleum Company and 30.7 percent at the Amerada Hess Corporation, but fell 20.9 percent at the Unocal Corporation.

title: Driesell Suspends 2
description: Lefty Driesell , the coach of the highly ranked Maryland basketball team, has suspended Adrian Branch , one of his starters, and Steve Rivers , a substitute from Lutheran High School in New York, after both players were arrested on marijuana- possession charges near the Maryland campus Saturday night.

title: President Resigns Posts at Pittston
description: The Pittston Company yesterday announced the resignation of Hendrik J. Hartong Jr. as president and chief operating officer. Mr. Hartong also resigned as a director.

title: ADVERTISING
description: Scrabble for Young

title: Japan-U.S. Trade Pact Is Signed Tokyo to Ease Market Entry
description: Japan and the United States today signed an agreement intended to let American companies win a bigger slice of Japan's $3 billion-a-year telecommunications market.

title: STOPPING GRETZKY ADDS TO TRIVIA LORE
description: Rogatien Vachon's career as a head coach in the National Hockey League lasted two games, but the second one was very special. He was behind the Los Angeles bench Saturday night when the Kings stopped Wayne Gretzky's record scoring streak at 51 games.

title: WAVERLY PRESS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
KENTUCKY DEFEATS TENNESSEE, 93-74
description: Kenny Walker scored 18 points in the second half tonight and led Kentucky to a 93-74 victory over Tennessee in a Southeastern Conference game.

title: Bell Atlantic's New Markets
description: The Bell Atlantic Corporation said it had acquired an interest in a Denver-based mobile telephone and paging company that would allow it to enter those markets outside its own Middle Atlantic region. Bell Atlantic is one of the seven regional companies created by the breakup of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company.

title: Japan Convertible Bonds Advance LONDON, Jan. 30 (Reuters) - Japanese convertible bonds showed gains of up to 5 points in active trading today on the news that President Reagan was to seek a second term of office, dealers said. Sentiment was aided by overnight strength in Tokyo stocks.
description: Fixed-interest dollar bonds firmed around 1/4 point on the sharper-than- expected fall in the latest United States money supply figures, but trading was quiet. Many operators await Tuesday's report on the United States leading indicators for December.

title: MEDICARE-GLASER reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
ARMSTRONG WORLD INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss of $6,100,000, or 25 cents a share, for plant closings.

title: BOEING CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
WHO WILL REMEDY SCIENCE IN THE CLASSROOM?
description: TO criticize the schools' defects is easier than to fix them. Most Americans reject the idea of a uniform curriculum - even a good one - dictated by the Federal Government. Should the states take over? State mandates often pay more attention to politics than to education. Can change be left to 16,000 local school boards? That hardly seems to be a straight path to nationwide reforms.

title: PASQUALE FOOD CO reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
RLI CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After realized investment losses of $133,661 for the quarter and $111,387 for the year. c-Including realized investment gains of $60,575 for the quarter and $77,220 for the year.

title: WALCO NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: POLAND INCREASES PRICES ON SOME BASIC FOODS BY 10%
description: Prices of a number of basic foods were increased by an average of 10 percent today, but the authorities said the initial public reaction appeared to be calm.

title: STUART HALL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
HOUSLEY EXCITED BY ALL-STAR HONOR
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.

title: Tiger Sale Of Leasing Group Due $850 Million Debt Cut Seen
description: Tiger International Inc. said yesterday that it planned to sell or liquidate all of the Tiger Leasing Group's operations, which would reduce the company's debt by about $850 million, or more than half.

title: CONSOLIDATED PAPERS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
General Host
description: The General Host Corporation said it had agreed to acquire all the shares outstanding of Flower Time Inc. at $11 each, or a total of about $28 million.

title: AARON RENTS OF ATLANTA reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Dutch Bankruptcies Off
description: Dutch business bankruptcies fell 12 percent in 1983, to 6,316, from 7,194 in 1982, provisional figures from the Central Statistics Office showed today.

title: WORLD REACTION TO REAGAN DECISION IS MUTED
description: In capitals around the world, President Reagan's widely anticipated decision to seek re-election drew a largely muted response yesterday from government officials, the news outlets and ordinary people.

title: A SHINY METAL MOVIE STAR GOES 'HOME' TO BALTIMORE
description: A Long Island native that perfectly portrayed a bit of Baltimore circa 1959 in the movie ''Diner'' has finally found a permanent home, one particularly appropriate to its screen role.

title: PRODUCTION OPERATORS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
COMPUTER CONSOLES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
THE YOUNG PHYSICISTS: ATOMS AND PATRIOTISM AMID THE COKE BOTTLES
description: LIVERMORE, Calif.

title: ECHO BAY MINES LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: Comings and Goings
description: The salary dispute between the Michigan Panthers and Bobby Hebert , the quarterback who directed them to the championship of the United States Football League last season, has led him to leave training camp in Tempe, Ariz. Hebert is demanding that the front office renegotiate a contract that calls for him to receive $80,000 this season and annual increases of $10,000 the next three years.

title: EGG INDUSTRY PROBLEMS RISE
description: After 50 years in the egg business, 82-year-old Max Ballas last week swept the chicken coops at his Lumber City, Ga., farm, settled accounts with creditors, then sadly, and with some bitterness, said goodbye to his neighbors.

title: REPUBLIC GYPSUM CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
REFURBISHED 19-CENTURY SHOWPLACE
description: Members of the Senate Appropriations Committee may well be excused if their thoughts sometimes wander from paying for MX missiles or trying to trim the soaring deficit.

title: UNITED WATER RESOURCES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
KANSAS CITY LIFE INSURANCE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
ADVERTISING
description: Accounts

title: SCOUTING
description: Filling a Hole

title: LANE TELECOMMUNICATIONS reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
Hearing Is Set On Cribbs Pact
description: A Federal judge has scheduled a hearing Wednesday to determine the legality of a contract Joe Cribbs of the National Football League's Buffalo Bills signed with the Birmingham Stallions of the United States Football League.

title: FIRE IN TUNNEL STOPS 90 METRO-NORTH TRAINS
description: Thousands of Metro-North commuters were delayed during the morning rush hour yesterday when a smoky fire caused by a derailment disrupted 90 trains to Grand Central Terminal for up to five hours. No injuries were reported, and normal service was restored by 2 P.M.

title: Alcohol Poisoning Kills Man
description: A 19-year-old man died of heart failure and acute alcohol poisoning after drinking a quart of whisky and five bottles of beer while friends cheered, ''Go, go,'' the police said today. Kevin Barry, the Rowley police chief, said Jack A. Kelly of Newbury died early Sunday at Anna Jacques Hospital in Newburyport.

title: TREASURY BILL RATES DECLINE
description: Rates fell at the Treasury's weekly bill auctions yesterday. The average discount rate on the 90-day bills declined to 8.87 percent from 8.92 percent the week before, while that on the companion issue of six-month bills slipped to 8.97 percent from 9.01 percent.

title: GEORGIA-PACIFIC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss after an extraordinary charge of $56,000,000 from the settlement of litigation.

title: Advertising; A Booklet To Educate Managers
description: ADVERTISING: To know it is to love it. That's the thinking behind an undertaking of the American Business Press that it hopes will make its membership less susceptible to the vagaries of the economy.

title: AMERADA HESS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After foreign currency translation losses of $3,300,000 for the quarter and $3,900,000 for the year, gains from a change in depreciation accounting of $4,600,000 for the quarter and $21,900,000 for the year, a gain from the sale of 500,000 shares of Louisiana Land & Exploration Co. stock of $8,700,000 for the quarter and year, and a charge relating to Mukluk and other leases of $11,100,000 for the quarter and year. c-After foreign currency translation gains of $14,400,000 for the quarter and $73,000,000 for the year, and a gain of $28,700,000 for the quarter from the reversal of provisions made in prior periods in connection with potential tariff refunds.

title: Kurt H. Nadelmann, 83, Dies; Professor and Legal Scholar
description: Kurt H. Nadelmann, a former faculty member at the Harvard Law School and an expert on comparative law, died at Mt. Auburn Hospital in Cambridge, Mass., Thursday.

title: SHITE GROUP TIED TO BEIRUT BLASTS
description: A Government official said today that United States intelligence specialists were convinced that the truck bombings of American and French military installations in Beirut last October were carried out by a pro-Iranian Shiite Moslem group acting under Iranian direction and with Syrian approval.

title: Mets Waive Kingman
description: The Mets, as expected, asked waivers on Dave Kingman yesterday, and if no other team claims him within five days, they will release him unconditionally. The 35-year-old first baseman said, ''I'm not bitter,'' and added that he hoped to play somewhere in the majors next season.

title: Strike by Nurses Averted in Passaic
description: Nurses at Passaic General Hospital today ratified a three-year contract that had been reached two hours before a 6:30 A.M. strike deadline, officials said.

title: Canadian Fastest
description: Gary Athans of Canada had the fastest time today in the first round of practice runs for a men's World Cup downhill race Thursday, the last such event before the Olympics. Athans covered a 3,000- meter course in 1 minute 56.23 seconds, 31-hundredths of a second better than Urs Raeber of Switzerland, who was second fastest. The leading American was Bill Johnson, who did 1:58.49.

title: MCDONALD'S CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
REAGAN APPEAL ON ABORTION IS MADE TO FUNDAMENTALISTS
description: President Reagan today renewed his call for a constitutional ban on abortion, equating the issue with the Civil War struggle to end slavery and contending that aborted fetuses suffer ''long and agonizing'' pain.

title: HAMMERMILL PAPER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Year-ago results include an extraordinary charge of $3,690,000 from the exchange of stock for long-term notes.

title: ARMCO SET TO LEAVE INSURANCE
description: Armco Inc., the diversified steelmaker based in Middletown, Ohio, announced yesterday that it would sell its domestic and international insurance businesses, which have suffered losses in recent months.

title: COLLEAGUE AND ADVISER
description: Walter F. Mondale first met the fellow Midwesterner who was to become one of his top political advisers and professional colleagues in a bar called the Boom Boom Room in Miami Beach. It was not a friendly encounter.

title: Baryshnikov Talks With A.B.T. Continue
description: The executive committee of the American Ballet Theater and Mikhail Baryshnikov, the company's artistic director, have agreed to keep talking about Mr. Baryshnikov's plans for the future. The decision was announced by Edgar Vincent, Mr. Baryshnikov's personal representative, and confirmed by Melville Straus, chairman of the company's board of directors.

title: Joseph Schwartz Plays Bartok and Beethoven
description: Joseph Schwartz demonstrated such sophisticated pianism in his recital at Merkin Hall on Sunday afternoon that it seemed peculiar at first that he is not better known. A winner of the Naumburg Competition 28 years ago, Mr. Schwartz has, of course, had a recital career.

title: MANILA PANEL IS TOLD THE MILITARY BARRED AQUINO BACKERS AT AIRPORT
description: Minutes before Benigno S. Aquino Jr. was slain last summer at the airport here, the military barred his relatives and friends from the gate where his plane was about to arrive, a citizen's investigating commission was told today.

title: TEXAS FEDERAL FINANCIAL reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: NOTES ON FASHION
description: ACCORDING to Donald Trump,

title: The U.N. Today; Jan. 31, 1984
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: EX-CHIEF OF OTB SAYS KOCH TRIED TO USE HIS AGENCY FOR PATRONAGE
description: A former president of New York City's Offtrack Betting Corporation said yesterday that Mayor Koch was wrong when he insisted last week that jobs at the agency were not subject to political patronage.

title: Olympic Flame Dispute
description: The mayor of Ancient Olympia, a village on the site of the original Olympic Games, threatened today to keep the Olympic flame from being transported to Los Angeles for the Summer Games. Mayor Spyros Fotinos said that many of the 700 villagers objected to a plan for commercial sponsorship of runners' carrying the torch across the United States on its way to California.

title: Continental Air
description: Continental Air Lines, in the latest round of its fight to keep flying under Bankruptcy Court protection, asked a judge to approve cancellation of union contracts it says are out of line with the marketplace. Continental already unilaterally voided the contracts, but needs court approval of that action to go forward with its reorganization. In a separate move, Continental filed a $250 million suit against the International Association of Machinists in Los Angeles, accusing association leaders of forging ballots to attain a two-thirds strike vote majority last August.

title: Muffin Mixes Are Withdrawn
description: Three muffin mixes containing residues of the cancer-causing pesticide ethylene dibromide will be withdrawn by Procter & Gamble Company from California grocery shelves but will remain on sale in other states. In a news release, Procter & Gamble said the products withdrawn bear the following codes: Duncan Hines Bran Muffin, Code 3180W4 and 3181W4; Duncan Hines Blueberry Muffin Mix, Code 3277W4; Duncan Hines Spicy Apple Muffin Mix, Code 3223W4.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * American Express Co. has elected to its board F. M. Kirby, chairman and chief executive of the Alleghany Corp.

title: MAINE PUBLIC SERVICE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Market PlaceVartanig G. Vartan Tylenol Maker In Doldrums
description: D URING October 1982, in the wake of the Tylenol poison scare, shares of Johnson & Johnson sold as low as 38 3/4. Then, thanks to aggressive moves by the company, the stock made a speedy recovery. By December that same year it had registered a record high of 51 1/4.

title: BORG-WARNER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Year-ago share earnings have been adjusted to reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid in November 1983.

title: TIME INC. PROFIT WIDENS
description: Time Inc. yesterday reported a 24 percent increase in fourth-quarter earnings from continuing operations, fueled by profits from its cable television enterprises and robust magazine revenues. Time's earnings for all of 1983 from continuing operations rose 16.5 percent, despite a $47 million loss in the third quarter from its defunct TV-Cable Week magazine.

title: LEHMAN BROS. PLANS BROOKLYN OFFICE
description: The Wall Street financial house of Lehman Brothers Kuhn Loeb would locate some of its computer operations across the East River in a vacant industrial building in Brooklyn, under a tentative agreement with the builders of the Fulton Landing redevelopment project.

title: OHIO CASUALTY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SANDGATE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
COMPANY NEWS
description: Florida Challenges Banking at K Mart

title: Shamrock Sale
description: The Diamond Shamrock Corporation said its Natomas North America unit had tentatively agreed to sell its United States onshore producing and nonproducing oil and gas properties to the Apache Petroleum Company for $160 million.

title: RUDDICK CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
NEW HAMPSHIRE SAVINGS BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: HOUSTON GAS MAY BID FOR COASTAL
description: The Houston Natural Gas Corporation, a takeover target of the Coastal Corporation, is seriously considering making a bid for Coastal as a defensive step, Wall Street professionals said yesterday.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of an error by the Census Bureau, an Associated Press article published Jan. 16 about a study of wives earning more than their husbands incorrectly listed the number of authors. There was one, Suzanne M. Bianchi.

title: FINANCE/NEW ISSUES
description: Bank of Boston Corp. Sets Floating-Rate Note

title: NOW THAT IT'S OFFICIAL, CAMPAIGN IS A CENTRAL WHITE HOUSE CONCERN
description: Nancy Reagan says she expects her husband's re-election campaign to be 'real tough.' Page A16.

title: LOUISIANA LAND OFFSHORE EXPLORATION CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DEMOCRATS CONCUR ON LINESOF ATTACK
description: Political Memo

title: Apple Shifting Product Lines
description: Apple Computer Inc. announced yesterday that it was reorganizing its product lines, and named three executives to supervise the divisions.

title: Senate Panel Criticized On Vatican Nominee
description: A coalition of religious and civil liberties groups charged yesterday that the Senate Foreign Relations committee was pushing ahead too quickly on President Reagan's nomination of William Wilson as the nation's first full Ambassador to the Vatican.

title: TYLER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Chess: British Grandmaster Wins The Brighton Tournament
description: The British grandmaster John Nunn posted an undefeated 7-2 score to win the Brighton International Tournament in England. FINAL STANDINGS Player W.L.D.Pts. Nunn5047Short5226W. Watson6306Hodgson3245Westerinen2254 1/2Mednis3424Murey3424Plaskett2344I. Ivanov3513 1/2Burger1801

title: Article 213039 -- No Title
description: Brazil will probably need to borrow around $4 billion from commercial banks in 1985, its Finance Minister, Ernane Galveas, said today at the symposium being held here by the European Management Foundation. Speaking to the annual gathering of business executives and political leaders, Mr. Galveas declined to specify the exact sum being considered but said it would be about half of the $8 billion borrowed in 1983. Brazil has just finished negotiating fresh bank loans of $6.5 billion to get it through 1984 plus extensions on existing loans and lines of credit to finance imports.

title: UNITED TECHNOLOGIES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including two extraordinary, nonrecurring gains totaling $107 million.

title: RULES ON NEWS ASSAILED
description: Representatives of newspaper publishers, editors and reporters and journalism educators told the Senate Commerce Committee today that Federal rules governing the news content of television and radio news broadcasts were in conflict with the First Amendment and should be repealed.

title: MONDALE IS ENDORSED BY STRAUSS
description: Robert S. Strauss, the former Democratic Party chairman, endorsed Walter F. Mondale for the party's Presidential nomination tonight, and Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., the Speaker of the House, is expected to follow suit Wednesday..

title: Bush Asserts U.S. Is 'Farther From War'
description: Vice President Bush said today that the United States was ''farther away from war today than we've been any time in the nuclear age.''
